article_title: Driver Killed After Losing Control, Hitting SUV
article_text:
A man from Hughesville, Maryland, was killed he lost control of his vehicle and struck another car heading the other way, according to investigators.

Prince George’s County police said Adrean Austin, 33, was critically injured in the Friday evening crash. He was pronounced dead a short time later.

Investigators said Austin was heading northbound on Brandywine Road, in Hughesville, when he lost control while on a curve. His car crossed into the southbound lanes and struck a SUV.

The driver of the SUV was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

Investigators said Austin was heading northbound on Brandywine Road, in Hughesville, when he lost control while on a curve.
The driver of the SUV was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
His car crossed into the southbound lanes and struck a SUV.
